forumNotes.author: Hy T. Diep
forumNotes.content: Is there some time of software that I can use to encrypt my files on the flashdrive, but still be able to boot in to all my Bootable Usb Disks? Or is there some type of hardware trick? Like to create 2 partitions on the Flash Drive 1 partition being the Bootable Disks and the other for Encryption?

forumNotes.author: misty
forumNotes.content:
**@Hy T.Diep**   
You could try [Truecrypt](http://www.truecrypt.org/ "External link").  

I've been using this for a while to encrypt sensitive data to transport it between home and office. This has been an unofficial way of getting stuff into work as my tight manager has refused to purchase the *official* encrypted USB sticks that are allowed on the system.  

As of last week it's no longer an option for me as I no longer have the account privileges needed to mount the image file I've encrypted. It does however work well if you have the necessary account privileges.  

Regards,  

Misty

forumNotes.author: dog
forumNotes.content:
You wont be able to encrypt "all bootable images", I think a separate encrypted file or partition is the best you can expect.  
AFAIK no-one has reported success integrating truecrypt pre-boot authentication into a PE.

forumNotes.author: diaoor
forumNotes.content: try flash drive encryption software, I have tried truecrypt(www.truecrypt.org) and USB Security([http://www.abetterso...b-security.html](http://www.abettersoft.com/usb-security.html "External link")). there are all great, truecrypt is opensource freeware; USB Security supports to encrypt part or whole of the external drive; you can view your encrypted data on any other computers without to install the encryption software. only type the password to access the encrypted external drive. good luck.
